Key Match Events: Iván Barton added 11 minutes of stoppage time in the second half, which was critical for both Mexico and Honduras.
Honduras scored a late goal in the 10th minute of added time, forcing a penalty shootout.
Mexico advanced 4-2 on penalties after César Huerta's decisive third attempt.
Iván Barton faced criticism for his decisions, including a controversial penalty call and favoring Mexico.
Post-Match Reflections: Mexico's advancement was controversially aided by the referee's decisions.
Honduras' late goal and the subsequent penalty shootout were high-pressure moments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Iván Barton has a history of controversial decisions, including a penalty call in a World Cup qualifier and not showing a yellow card to Lionel Messi.
